config.question: The role of women was unique in the __________ tribe in that they were in charge of family property, and kinship descended from the mother’s side.

answer_3.response: The Plains tribes divided labor tasks according to gender. Men hunted, traded, supervised ceremonial activities, and cleared ground for planting. They usually held the positions of authority, such as chief or medicine man. Women were responsible for childrearing and artistic activity. They also did the camp work, grew vegetables, prepared buffalo meat and hides, and gathered berries and roots. In most tribes, women played an important role in political, economic, and religious activities. Among the Navajo and Zuni, kinship descended from the mother’s side, and Navajo women were in charge of most of the family’s property.
